features: Note: 1)Too coarse a grind, too little coffee, or insufficiently tamping the grounds before brewing can all lead to inadequate pressure for a proper brew. 2)It is important to note that the amount of espresso extracted will vary depending on the grind size and amount and reprogramming may be needed when the size and amount are adjusted
Single-serve coffee maker with dual brewing modes
Switch between convenient k-cup capsule brewing or using fresh coffee grounds for traditional brewing
Single-serve design is ideal for kitchens, break rooms, dorm rooms, and more
Fits standard coffee cups or travel mugs 6 to 14 ounces; 24 ounce refillable water reservoir; removable drip tray for easy cleanup and auto-shutoff function after brew cycle is complete
UL/cUL certified for safety and performance

NOTE: This product is intended to be used with K-Cup style capsules. If defective or other style capsules are used the appliance may not operate properly. The appliance may leak or allow hot liquid or hot coffee to spill from the brewer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The size was perfect fits on counter perfectly, better still makes great coffee good hot 170 temp , good tastes fast as well but it got well love it, I love it does both so easily pods and your choice coffee. Awesome job.Update as of 9-25-23I've had questions come to me so here a up date.The unit is 120vAC,60HZ, 10 AMPS,1200 WATSI learned it needs it cleaning about every 50 cups of coffee it easy and fast so don't fret, I experienced it not filling the cup so I cleaned it something that should be done when you first get it removed anything that it got during the build, it does take normal capsules off coffee k cups as normal known , it needs your choice coffee as well, note there are full masks in the strainer don't over fill, if coffee to fine close to powder it may not brew your coffee right , it act like a clog, medium ground does great, . This coffee maker does GREAT ,I LOVE IT FOR PRICE AND GOOD HOT COFFEE AWESOME, AND MY FAVORITE POD TO! LOOKS GREAT DOES GREAT HOT YOU WILL NOT BE SORRY!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazon VERY Basic, but useful
reviews.reviewText: I opted for this single cup capsule coffee maker at a deep discount, which makes it approximately a quarter of the price of the most well known name brand.It's very simple to use. I can use either a K cup or the reusable cup that comes with the machine. There is no reservoir. The water you pour in is the water you are going to get out, from 6 to 14 ounces.I opted for a 10 ounce cup and placed 2 tablespoons of grounds in the reusable cup. It takes a few minutes to receive a cup of coffee. The temperature of the coffee upon completion was just under 180 degrees.The results were a little light for my taste so I will use a little more coffee from now on. But it was a pleasant cup.This little guy is not a work horse. It needs a breather between cups.My plan is to take this to my workplace, so I can keep my coffee-snobbery to myself and have a fresh cup of something stronger than the dishwater available in the break room. NOTE: Amazon Basic makes a larger version of this machine that does have a reservoir for multi cup use, and a couple other neat features. There's a terrific review video included in the images of the item

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Being too cheap to buy a Keurig, as I don't drink coffee a whole ton, I decided to get one of these. A few months in, it hasn't been a terrible experience. It works as expected and is super easy to use. I did have a problem where it apparently dumped its water when not in use, not sure where it leaked from but came to a kitchen counter soaked in water. But it's only happened once and I've since emptied the reservoir after using it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good K-Cup Brewer
reviews.reviewText: This was purchased in February 2023 when our current K-Cup Brewer was showing signs of wearing out. We started using it in April 2023. This rather simple brewer. Is still going strong today (January 2024). It has lasted longer than our last 2 K-Cup brewers. We average about 5-6 cups of coffee/day. This brewer does not have all the bells and whistles of other brands. No clock, no auto start in morning, no bottom heater. It does auto shut of after finishing a brew and turns back on when push the size select button. It 6 oz to 14 oz brews. Be aware, the brews are actually a bit oversized.Coffee is just as good as the more expensive brewers. This standard size brewer has a 24oz reservoir. Highly recommend, very fair price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: For the price I didn't expect much, but was hoping for more. Needed a small coffee keurig pot for my home office so I stay focused during work and don't interupt meetings by running upstairs to the main coffee maker.Pros:Small design and doesn't take up space.Easy to clear, looks sharp.Easy to fill reservoirNice to have pod for both keurig capsules or grounds.InexpensiveMulitple options for what size to brewConsSeems to leak water after brewing. Have brewed several cups now. Waiting several minutes before removing and come to find a noticeable puddle underneath.24 oz is about 2 real cups of coffee, but with the aforementioned leaks it's not even that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So simple but works as intended for me
reviews.reviewText: I received the Amazon Basic coffee maker today (1/6/24) and tried it for the first time. The water reservoir is only 24 ounces but that's okay for me because it's easier for me to fill since I have dexterity issues with my hands and wrists. What I did was fill it right below the MAX line.I used a reusable K-cup pod in the K-cup attachment that comes with it. so those who say you can't use it, YES you can. I use whole beans because I like to grind my own coffee beans very fine. I have the reusable colored K-cup pods that have a colored part that you place even with the groove in the reusable K-cup pod attachment and put the tab facing up.Nothing splattered from the machine onto the counter. I put the drip tray in the upper part to use a small cup. It does take a little bit for the water to heat, but the coffee came out of the reusable K-cup just fine with no issues and the coffee tasted great. Again, I don't mind the 24-oz water reservoir because it's easier to fill even though you have to fill it as you need to. Next time I'll try the reusable K-cup-like attachment that comes with the coffee maker. so far, so good with no issues.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars For how cheap it is it is AMAZING. cheapest you can get and does the job VERY well
reviews.reviewText: This product is the cheapest I have found by ALOT. I was worried because how much cheaper it is. IT works just as good. They have ALOT of oz options which was key for me. I almost bought the 150$ one until i saw no 12 oz? i was like wtf no 12 oz thats the main one. Then another had no 12 or 10 only 4 and 6 . This one has 10 and 12 and another higher one. The only problem is you have to refill the water very often that is ALL. If you are too lazy to put water in then this is not for you but other then that it works just as good and better in some areas then the expensive ones.
Muy práctica y facial de usar la cafetera Amazon . Su doble función de cápsulas y café , la hace fantástica!

I was looking for a small coffee maker when me and my partner go away. We went to Vegas recently and this was clutch as a lot hotel rooms don't have coffee makers in the rooms. This made a great cup and it was easy to take along.

Although this little machine takes a few seconds longer to make a cup of coffee than some others... it makes that coffee well. Good tasting and very hot. Taking that few seconds longer means the water is actually utilizing the coffee grounds as it passes through. We love this little machine. It also takes up very little space on the counter and is really easy to use. Pour the amount of water you want (use the cup you're making coffee in to measure), put a pod into place, push the button... and about a minute and a half later, you get a good, hot cup of brew.
Calienta bastante rapido, es facil de limpiar y considero es un muy buen producto vs costo.
Me gusto Que have cafe rapids. Pero esta muy caro . Walmart la vende por 20 dollars.
